intro: Chaenorhinum minus subsp. idaeum, commonly known as the lesser common toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a low-growing annual herb with slender stems and opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers with four petals, typical of the Campanulaceae family. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands, roadsides, and waste areas. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
